pull.title: Do not shadow variables in src/wallet
pull.body:
Continues #8105.

Review of this should be pretty straight forward. Just compare binaries. View the diff in visual diff or so.

To provide tested ACK, cherrypick paveljanik@5d2f98e and compare master build log and this PR build log.

events.body: ACK: `objdump -d $bin` returns the same binaries for me on d5b25fa

issue.title: avoid shadowing vars, and enable -Wshadow
issue.body:
I haven't looked into a fix for this, but it should be easy to implement and hopefully uncontroversial.

Relavant bug: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8102#issuecomment-221934374

TODO:
- [x] `univalue` shadowing fix (merged, synced to our tree )
- [x] `serialize.h` and `nVersion`, `nType` collisions (~~#8468~~ #9039 )
- [x] `LOCK` inside `LOCK`shadowing (using `__COUNTER__` for `LOCK` macro) (#8472)
- [x] other misc source fixes
- [x] enabling `-Wshadow` (#8794)
- [x] document `-Wshadow` and add developer notes about it (#8794)
- [ ] `leveldb` shadowing fix ? (https://github.com/google/leveldb/pull/378, but fixed by other changes there.)
- [ ] GCC Set #8808

issue.title: [Wallet][DB] Back ports up to the CWallet/CWalletDB/CDB refactor.
issue.body:
Upgrading the wallet, wallet db and db wrapper areas with several back ports and updates adaptations.

List of PRs:
* #5933
* #7537
* #8191
* #8564
* #8574
* #8629
* #9353

Note:
Low priority PR, can be reviewing after merge Sapling and tier two PRs. 
I made it because we are pretty far from upstream in the db area and want to introduce some new functionality in the future that requires a more up-to-date db layer.

comments.body: I'm not sure promoting these return values up to the function scope is a good idea. Keeping the scope of variables as small as possible ensures that results won't leak or accidentally influence other things.

Technically speaking, this is not directly function scope.

But yes, one view is to have only one return value variable, the other is one return value variable per function call.

Renaming `ret` to `ret1` here could make this particular change smaller.
Done and squashed - now all the changes are of the same kind.
